documents.title: sexual harassment : not just an uber issue
text: the bbc 's technology reporter in san francisco is covering the uber sexual harassment sackings .
here 's his take on the fall-out .
it goes without saying that this issue does n't go away with these firings .
uber has major questions still to answer - some of them will hopefully be addressed when more details of the report are made public .
most troubling is why uber 's own internal hr measures were n't thorough or fair enough to see that the actions of 20 employees warranted dismissal .
instead it took a brave former employee - and then an expensive , lengthy investigation - to get to that point .
so as well as detailing what it has done to address those existing complaints , uber will now have to be very clear about how it will handle such issues in future .
crucially , the lessons from this report should not be heeded by uber alone .
as many people have pointed out to me since we began reporting this story , this is a problem that affects the technology industry across the board . ''

documents.title: super-rich 'underpay most tax '
text: super-rich people underpay the most tax , according to a study written up in the economist .
three economists crunched data from the `` swiss leaks '' and `` panama papers '' data leaks to estimate the extent of tax evasion .
they found the richest 0.01 % of the population in scandinavia underpaid tax by about 30 % , compared with the average household underpaying by 3 % .

documents.title: wall street closes lower ahead of uk vote and comey hearing
text: us stocks have closed lower as investors shunned riskier assets ahead of what is expected to be a busy thursday .
the uk will go to the polls and former fbi director james comey will testify before congress .
mr comey , who was investigating alleged ties between president donald trump 's 2016 campaign and russia , was fired in may .
the european central bank will also make policy announcements .
the dow jones industrial average was down 45.78 points , or 0.22 % , at 21,138.26 and the s & p 500 was down 6.76 points , or 0.28 % , at 2,429.33 .
the nasdaq composite was down 20.63 points , or 0.33 % , at 6,275.06 .

documents.title: us and mexico reach sugar pact
text: the us and mexican governments have reached a new agreement in principle on trade in sugar , us commerce secretary wilbur ross has said .

the agreement , which calls for mexico to export a smaller proportion of refined sugar and a larger proportion of raw sugar to the us , was not endorsed by us producers , news agency reuters reported .

documents.title: uber 'fires more than 20 after harassment probe '
text: more than 20 people at uber have been fired after a workplace practices review , bloomberg reports .
the review came after susan fowler , a former uber engineer , said she had been sexually harassed by a supervisor , the new york times reports .

documents.title: saudi arms dealer adnan khashoggi dies
text: saudi arms dealer adnan khashoggi , a billionaire businessman known for his lavish lifestyle , has died in london at the age of 82 .
his family said in statement that he died peacefully while being treated for parkinson 's disease .
mr khashoggi became one of the world 's richest men in the 1970s and '80s by brokering international arms deals .
his parties became legendary , often lasting for days , but there was also controversy about his business .
read the full story here .

documents.title: investors look ahead to comey 's testimony
text: stock markets are lower and subdued before what could potentially be a dynamite thursday .
in the uk , there is the general election .
in the us , the former director of the fbi james comey will testify in front of us congress .
randy frederick , vice president of trading and derivatives for charles schwab , says : `` we have a relatively light week in terms of economic data and investors are awaiting thursday 's events .
`` the market 's reaction to comey 's testimony would depend on if he says something new that nobody knows about , although , a lot of what he might be asked could be classified information . ''

documents.title: share and share alike
text: ride-hailing companies uber and lyft have been ordered to hand over details about their san francisco operations .
the city attorney wants access to four years ' worth of data about driver practices and the areas they serve .
uber and lyft have 15 days to comply or face charges of contempt and other court-imposed penalties .

documents.title: oil volatile amid middle east diplomatic row
text: the stand-off in the middle east is causing the price of oil to flip-flop .
from an earlier fall , brent crude is now trading up 0.8 % at $ 49.85 a barrel .
us oil has also rebounded , up 1.1 % at $ 47.90 .

documents.title: mexico to cut share of refined sugar sent to us
text: mexico will reduce the proportion of refined sugar it can export to the united states to 30 % under a new agreement likely to be announced later on today , mexican economy minister ildefonso guajardo has said .
currently , the proportion of refined sugar exports from total sugar exports mexico can send to the us is 53 % .
mexican sugar has been duty-free in the us since 2008 in return for the mexican market being opened up to us corn-based fructose .
after protests from us sugar companies and farmers , both governments agreed to mexican sugar export quotas in 2014 .
but complaints from us sugar producers continued , and washington had threatened to impose tariffs of up to 80 % t on mexican sugar unless a deal was reached .

documents.title: dollar falls to lowest level since trump elected
text: the dollar index , which tracks the us currency against a basket of others , earlier hit its lowest level since 9 november , the day donald trump was elected .
according to the financial times , traders are nervous that the trump administration will not be able to push through proposed tax cuts , financial deregulation and infrastructure spending .

documents.title: could uk exports rival germany 's ?
text: if there is no deal , would a collapse in the pound make us an exporter to rival germany ?

business editor simon jack says : `` there is a general thought that if we do leave and we do have a hard brexit the pound will go down further now that is obviously good news for exporters , and there is some evidence that some exporters are seeing a build-up in their order books however , there 's a flipside to that it means that all the stuff we import goes up in price , and that is beginning to show up both in supply chains [ and ] prices . ''

documents.title: china 's hna eyes global growth
text: chinese firm hna could very well be the largest company most people have never heard of .
only founded in 1993 , it now owns aviation firm swissport , hainan airlines , 25 % of hilton worldwide and 10 % of deutsche bank .
its chief executive adam tan explains how hna aims to become one of the top 10 biggest companies in the world .

documents.title: how important is uk trade to the eu ?
text: does the eu export more to the uk or vice versa ?
economics editor kamal ahmed says the uk is an important market for the eu , but looking at trade in purely monetary terms could be misleading .

`` if you look in brute terms , it is right that the eu imports into the uk are worth about £ 290bn , our exports to the eu are worth about £ 230bn but if you look at percentages , which is actually rather more revealing , 43 % of our exports go to the eu , [ but ] only between 8 % and 17 % of their exports come to us .

britain is the fifth or sixth largest economy in the world , it is an important market but the notion that we 're more important than the eu is to us is a slight misnomer because it relies on those brute money numbers . ''
author: BBC News Channel

documents.title: hna : the biggest firm you 've never heard of
text: from aviation to banks , china 's hna group is snapping up businesses to become a major global firm .

documents.title: forbes : man united 'world 's most valuable football team '
text: manchester united has regained its title as world 's most valuable football team after five years off the top spot , according to forbes .
the team is worth $ 3.69bn ( £ 2.86bn ) , topping barcelona at $ 3.64bn and real madrid at $ 3.58bn , forbes says .

documents.title: demand for safe haven assets climbs amid uncertainty
text: investors turned to safe-haven gold and german government bonds on tuesday amid increasing political and economic uncertainty around the world .
gold rose to six-week highs and german 10-year borrowing costs to six-week lows .
meanwhile , world stocks fell and the dollar index , which tracks the greenback against a basket of currencies , fell to its lowest level since the us election .

analysts at german bank bayernlb say investors are feeling nervous about so called `` super thursday '' , when british voters will go to polls in an increasingly unpredictable general election , the european central bank is due to meet , and former fbi director james comey will testify before congress .
fears are also growing about tensions in the middle east after six arab nations cut diplomatic ties with qatar .

documents.title: us stock markets open lower
text: the dow jones industrial average has opened 52.96 points down at 21,131.08 .
the s & p 500 is off 6.58 points at 2,429.52 .
the nasdaq has fallen 14.88 points lower at 6,280.81 .

documents.title: volkswagen workers opt for retirement
text: volkswagen continues with its `` transformation '' plan amid the ongoing diesel emissions scandal - this time it has announced that nearly 9,300 staff have agreed to an early retirement scheme .
the scheme is aimed at people born between 1955 and 1960 .
volkswagen has guaranteed that there will be no forced redundancies as part of its `` transform 2025+ '' plan to cut the workforce and improve productivity by 25 % until 2025 .
those opting for the proverbial carriage clock have until 31 july to make up their minds .

documents.title: consumer slowdown hits south africa
text: analysts had forecast that south africa 's economy would expand by 0.9 % in the first quarter , instead of the 0.7 % contraction .
and it appears the trade , catering and accommodation sector was one of the main culprits .

capital economics africa economist john ashbourne says : `` the slowdown in [ the first quarter ] was due to much worse results from usually stable consumer-facing sectors that had been the key drivers of growth in recent years . ''

trade , catering and accommodation shrank by 5.9 % between january and march - `` awful data '' which standard chartered bank 's chief africa economist razia khan says shows weakness where it was not expected .

documents.title: amazon offers cheap prime to people on food stamps
text: people on food stamps are being offered cheaper access to amazon prime .
amazon said people receiving government assistance through the supplemental nutrition assistance program can get free shipping and unlimited streaming of movies and tv shows for $ 5.99 a month .
the service usually costs $ 10.99 a month .

documents.title: overseas investment in uk firms tumbles
text: overseas investment in uk firms fell to its lowest level for more than two years in the first quarter , the office for national statistics says .
foreign firms were involved in 40 buy-outs or mergers with uk firms worth £ 5.1bn - a fraction of the £ 50.4bn seen a year earlier and the lowest value since the end of 2014 .
it comes amid brexit uncertainty , which is seeing many companies put investment decisions on hold , and follows the pound 's slump since the eu referendum .
however , the ons said there were a number of very high valued deals seen last year and added the average number of deals has held `` broadly stable '' since the financial crisis .

documents.title: ftse still in negative territory
text: the ftse 100 is little changed this lunchtime .
a short while ago it was at 7,512.32 , that 's a fall of 13 points or 0.18 % .
miners randgold - up 2.13 % - and fresnillo up 1.97 % - posted the biggest gains , followed by easyjet , which was 1.12 % ahead .
the biggest fall was seen by medical products company convatec , which fell 5.26 % after shareholders nordic capital and avista sold 250 million shares , raising £ 805m .
merlin entertainments , the company behind alton towers and the london eye , fell for the second day running .
a short while ago it was 3.05 % lower .
b & q-owner kingfisher was down by 3.03 % .

text: more on the rbs settlement story .
a spokesman for the rbs shareholder action group said : `` the directors met last night to consider the legal advice and took the decision that this matter will not now go to court . ''

documents.title: qatar shares fall again
text: qatar 's stock market closed down for the second day running on tuesday , however , it only lost 1.54 % .
on monday it plunged by 7.3 % after six arab countries including saudi arabia and egypt cut diplomatic ties with qatar , accusing it of supporting extremism in the region .

documents.title: rangers fraud trial : craig whyte found not guilty
text: craig whyte has been found not guilty of acquiring rangers football club by fraud .
the former owner bought rangers in may 2011 for £ 1 while agreeing to take on obligations , which included paying an £ 18m bank debt and £ 5m for players .
mr whyte was acquitted of using the club 's own money for the deal while claiming the funds were his .
the jury also found him not guilty of breaching company law to achieve the takeover .

documents.title: vodafone : new rules to stop hate speech ads
text: vodafone has strengthened controls to stop its advertising appearing on sites that share hate speech and fake news .
the telecoms giant said its ads had been placed next to offensive content `` in a small minority of instances '' due to automated ad technologies .
it said it would use a `` whitelist '' approach to ensure vodafone ads were only placed on sites identified as highly unlikely to be focused on harmful content .
earlier this year big brands including m & s , audi and mcdonald 's pulled their online ads from youtube over concerns they were appearing next to offensive content .

documents.title: rbs down by nearly 2 %
text: following the news of the agreement struck between rbs and disgruntled shareholders , rbs shares are now trading 1.9 % lower .

documents.title: rbs deal will cost bank £ 200m
text: the deal announced today with the rbs shareholders will cost the bank about £ 200m .
the 2008 rights issue at the centre of the dispute aimed to raise £ 12bn for the bank after it headed up a consortium to buy abn amro .

documents.title: 'help us tap into new export markets '
text: we asked business leaders what they want from the next government .
british hovercraft company managing director emma pullen wants help to reach new export markets after the uk leaves the eu .

documents.title: ao shares recover some lost ground
text: ao world 's shares have clawed back some of the ground they lost earlier .
they 're currently about 6.5 % lower , having been down by 10 % earlier in the morning , after it warned that growth at its uk business was expected to slow `` significantly '' in the first quarter .

documents.title: manufacturing drags down south africa 's economy
text: south africa 's economy has slipped back into recession for the second time in a decade .
analysts had expected a better performance - they predicted a slight expansion of south africa 's economy .
but in the event , it shrank by 0.7 % in the first quarter of this year , following on from a quarter-on-quarter fall in the last quarter of 2016 .
the last time the country was in a technical recession was in 2009 , following the fallout from the global economic crisis .
while there were encouraging signs from south africa 's mining industry , the main sector that pulled back the gdp figures was manufacturing , which shrank by nearly 4 % in the second quarter .

it comes just a matter of weeks after the ratings agencies standard and poor 's and fitch downgraded south africa 's foreign-denominated sovereign debt to non-investment grade , or so-called junk status .
and last week they said weak economic growth and political uncertainty could lead to further downgrades .
the south african currency , the rand , fell by about 1 % on the news .
author: Matthew Davies
Editor, BBC Africa Business Report

documents.title: rbs deal agreed last night
text: the rbs shareholder action group voted to accept the 82p a share offer last night , avoiding the need for a trial , according to a spokesperson for the group .
they would not say whether the vote was unanimous or not .

documents.title: rbs shareholders confirm deal
text: the 9,000-strong rbs shareholders action group confirms that it has accepted the 82p a share compensation from the bank .
the case will not now go to court .

documents.title: rbs 'shareholders settle with bank '
text: hot on the heels of our post at 10:09am it seems , according to reuters , that rbs shareholders have in fact settled their dispute with the company .
the shareholders claim that rbs misled investors about the health of the bank in the run-up to its state bailout during the financial crisis .
they have accepted 82p a share in compensation - less than the 92p a share some investors wanted - let alone the 200p-230p that they paid to buy the shares in the rights issue nine years ago .
the dispute centres on rbs 's decision , during the financial crisis , to ask shareholders for billions of pounds worth of funds after it bought dutch rival abn amro .
shortly afterwards , the government was forced to prop up the bank with £ 45bn of taxpayers ' money to save it from collapse .
the state still owns a 72 % stake in rbs .
the bank and former directors deny any wrongdoing .

documents.title: south africa falls into recession
text: south africa 's economy contracted in the first quarter of this year , pushing the continent 's largest economy into its first recession since 2009 , according to official data .
gdp shrank by 0.7 % following a 0.3 % contraction in the fourth quarter of 2016 , said stats sa .
industries including catering , accommodation and manufacturing have all been struggling as the rand has depreciated and the country has faced political upheaval .
in april , south africa 's credit rating was cut to junk status by the ratings agency s & p global .

documents.title: investor confidence in eurozone hits 10-year high
text: investor sentiment in the eurozone rose in june to its highest level in nearly a decade , a survey shows .
the frankfurt-based sentix research group 's eurozone index rose to 28.4 points from 27.4 in may , reaching its highest level since since july 2007 .
it is the latest evidence that the bloc 's economic recovery is strengthening , as inflation and employment edge up .
research published yesterday showed that growth in eurozone services sector remained at its fastest pace for six years in may .

documents.title: saudi arabia revokes qatar airways licence
text: saudi arabia has revoked the operating licence of qatar airways and ordered the airline 's offices to close within 48 hours , afp reports , quoting saudi state media .
it comes after the united arab emirates , saudi arabia , egypt , bahrain , libya and yemen cut ties with the gulf state over its alleged links to terrorism .

`` the general authority of civil aviation has decided to cancel all licenses granted to qatar airways and to close all of its offices in the kingdom within 48 hours , '' read a statement carried by the saudi press agency .

documents.title: dollar index at lowest since trump election
text: the dollar index - which tracks the dollar 's value relative to a basket of different currencies - has hit its lowest level since 9 november , the day after president trump 's election .
the fall comes ahead of the uk general election on thursday , along with a european central bank meeting and former fbi director james comey 's testimony to a senate committee this week .

`` it 's difficult to pinpoint a single factor [ for the fall ] but the uk elections and comey 's testimony will take place on the same day , which is making the market nervous , '' said bart wakabayashi , tokyo branch manager of state street bank .
`` the dollar is already on the defensive after friday 's [ us ] jobs data , and now it 's facing potential geopolitical risk in the form of comey 's testimony . ''
mr comey was fired by president trump last month .
he is due to answer questions about whether the president tried to make him drop an investigation into alleged ties between the president 's 2016 election campaign and russia .

documents.title: ftse 100 pares loses
text: london 's benchmark index has pared some losses to trade 0.08 % lower at 7,519.69 .
commodity stocks have been weighing on the index after the prices of oil and copper fell .
glencore , rio tinto , anglo american , bp and shell are all down .

paige jackson of radical childcare in birmingham wants to see more options for childcare in workplaces .

documents.title: rbs case to go ahead ?
text: royal bank of scotland shareholders have raised millions of pounds at the 11th-hour in an attempt to push ahead with a court case against the state-owned bank , according to a source involved in the claim .

the investors have now raised the £ 7m needed to convince a high court judge tomorrow that they can afford the 14-week trial , according to scottish businessman neil mitchell , a former customer and critic of the lender .
they claim that rbs misled investors about the health of the bank in the run-up to its state bailout during the financial crisis .
rbs denies any wrongdoing , but is reported to have increased its offer of compensation in recent weeks to reach a settlement with the shareholders .
5/5 having exchanged skeleton arguments with @ twitterid already the claimants are fully prepared to commence trial on wednesday .

documents.title: discounter popularity about more than price
text: more on that news that within five years £ 1 in every £ 7 will be spent at a discounter like aldi or lidl ( see earlier post ) .
on 5 live breakfast vanessa henry , shopper insight manager at igd , which carried out the research , said discounters ' growing popularity was about more than saving money .
`` it 's not just about price , lots of people are choosing to shop in discounters yes , because they do offer keen prices , but for lots of different reasons as well .
`` a number of shoppers we talk to say they shop in the likes of aldi and lidl because it 's actually a more convenient shopping option for them .
there a smaller range of products in those stores so you can actually get in and out a bit quicker than you would do in some of the larger format stores .

`` but also i think shoppers recognise the investment that discounters have made within their ranges within their own label products and a lot of these products have won awards over recent years , so shoppers are recognising quality improvements in these stores as well . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: another poll shows labour gaining
text: late last night a survation poll put the conservatives a mere 1.1 point ahead of labour to win the general election .
this knocked the pound a bit but it 's since up again , to trade 0.12 % higher against the dollar at $ 1.2919 .
kathleen brooks , an analyst at city index , says the conservatives are still the favourites to win and most traders are n't betting on a hung parliament .
`` betting odds still put the chances of a conservative majority at 92 % , '' she says .
`` most sophisticated gbp traders are not worried about the prospect of a hung parliament and drawn out negotiations to form a coalition government , '' she adds .

documents.title: keeping encryption 'mainly about profit '
text: in the wake of the london bridge attack , theresa may called on the major tech firms to think again about encryption , which renders messages sent on platforms such as telegram impenetrable - something terrorists have taken advantage of .
rohan silva , an entrepreneur and former senior policy adviser to david cameron , tells today encryption was only introduced in 2014 .
`` tech firms do n't want to get rid of it because they do n't want to lose customers or profits , '' he says .
he thinks tech firms could allow the security services access to suspects ' messaging services without having to ban encryption outright .

but jennifer arcuri , a co-founder of cyber-security service hacker house , says any moves to weaken encryption would `` open the floodgates '' for governments and hackers to listen into our communications .
`` you have no way of curtailing which bad guys can get in , '' she says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: retail spending falls in may , says brc
text: retail spending fell last month as shoppers tightened their belts in the face of rising inflation , according to the british retail consortium .
it said like-for-like retail sales dropped by 0.4 % in may , down from 0.5 % growth last year .
online sales of non-food products also slumped to the lowest level since records began in 2012 , growing by 4.3 % last month compared to a 13.7 % jump in 2016 .
`` overall , may 's sales slowdown is indicative of a longer-term trend of a decline in consumer spending power , '' brc chief executive helen dickinson said .
consumer price inflation rose to 2.7 % in april , its highest since september 2013 .

documents.title: apple shares slip after speaker release
text: apple shares fell 1 % yesterday after the tech giant launched its first home speaker , the homepod .
north america technology correspondent , dave lee , says there is nothing wrong with the quality of the speaker .
the issue is that apple has lagged behind rivals amazon and google in releasing a smart speaker and its personal assistant software siri is generally considered to be inferior .
siri may need an overhaul , he believes , but this could be tough as apple does not have nearly as much data on its users as google does .
`` however , i think fans of apple will still be interested in getting one of these speakers , '' he says praising the device 's look and feel .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: commodity headwinds hit ftse
text: connor campbell , an analyst at spreadex , says commodity stocks are dragging on the ftse 100 .

`` with brent crude below $ 49.50 per barrel - the black stuff quickly decided that the qatar-blockade was n't the recovery-sparking news it needed - and copper dropping another 1.2 % , there was little for the oil and mining stocks to do but open in the red .
`` this prevented the ftse from gaining any momentum after the bell , though it has to be said its 10 points fall could have been a lot worse . ''

documents.title: ao world shares plunge
text: shares in ao world opened down by 7 % in london .
neil wilson , senior market analyst at etx capital said it was because `` investors took fright at the group 's £ 12m loss '' .
he added : `` it 's tough shifting fridges and big-screen tvs .
without slashing prices , and destroying margins in the process , customers can go just about anywhere .
`` ao world is also burning cash on a european expansion and investors may be losing patience a touch with the strategy . ''
nevertheless , he more optimistic about the future and thinks `` rising revenues and a push into europe offers hope that profits may be forthcoming '' .

documents.title: noble group on the brink
text: it has been a sharp fall from grace for what used to be asia 's biggest commodity trader .
noble group saw its singapore-listed shares slump as much as 10 % to to their lowest since 2000 today on concerns the firm is on the brink of collapse .
it has lost more than 80 % of its market value this year and is in talks with creditors to settle more than $ 2bn in debts by the end of 2018 .
noble 's problems first began two years ago after its accounting practices were criticised by an anonymous research group and commodity prices collapsed .
author: Leisha Chi
Business reporter in Singapore

documents.title: ftse falls at start of trade
text: the ftse 100 has opened slightly lower on tuesday - it was down 7 points or 0.10 % at 7,518.41 .
yesterday the index closed 0.3 % down on the record high it hit on friday .

documents.title: shawbrook rejects £ 868m bid
text: challenger bank shawbrook has turned down an increased final offer of £ 868m from private equity groups trying to take control of the lender .
in a statement shawbrook said .
`` the independent directors believe that the final offer undervalues shawbrook and its prospects and therefore advise that shareholders take no action with regards to the final offer . ''

marlin bidco , the buyout vehicle which was set up by bc partners and pollen street partners , raised its offer for independent lending and savings bank shawbrook by just over 3 % on monday , in an effort to persuade another 5 % of shareholders to accept the deal .

documents.title: easyjet and ryanair passenger numbers jump
text: easyjet carried 7,512,545 passengers in the month ended may 2017 , that 's a 9.5 % rise on may last year .
its load factor - basically how full its planes were - remained steady at 91.5 %
in the year to the end of may 2017 , it carried 77,332,031 passengers , up from 71,495,087 during the previous 12 months , that 's a rise of 8.2 % .

meanwhile , rival budget airline ryanair saw its passenger numbers grow by 11 % to 11.8 million in may , with a load factor up 1 % to 95 % , while rolling annual traffic to may grew 13 % to 122.5m customers .
ryanair 's kenny jacobs said he increases were `` on the back of lower fares and the continuing success of our `` always getting better '' customer experience programme '' .

documents.title: ao expects 'significant slowdown ' as inflation climbs
text: appliance retailer ao world says it expects growth in the first quarter of 2017 to `` slow significantly '' due to a challenging trading environment .
the firm said its losses had widened in 2016 to £ 12m from £ 10.6m in 2015 , while sales jumped 17 % to £ 701.2m .
however , chief executive steve caunce said trading had been `` mixed '' , particularly in the uk .
`` in the first half of the year , in the uk , our investment in marketing and brand translated into encouraging sales growth with some tailwinds from stamp duty changes in march 2016 .

`` in the second half of the year , trading in the uk became more challenging as we began to feel the impacts of dampening consumer confidence following the uk 's vote to leave the eu , subsequent price inflation and a slow-down in the uk housing market . ''

documents.title: australia stocks fall after rba decision
text: australia is expected to equal the record for the world 's longest run of uninterrupted economic growth with its gdp report tomorrow .
but the numbers may show a contraction and markets are n't cheering .

shares on the benchmark s & p/asx 200 fell by 1.4 % to 5,676.60 on tuesday after the reserve bank of australia left interest rates unchanged at a record low , despite calls for it to address weakening growth .
`` we suspect the rba would be willing to look through a temporary fall in gdp , but it would find it harder to ignore two weak quarters in a row , '' paul dales from capital economics said .
`` while our central forecast is that interest rates will remain at 1.5 % this year , the chances of a cut later in the year have increased somewhat . ''
elsewhere in asia , other major markets are also mostly in the red .
japan 's nikkei lost 1 % to close at 19,970.35 with the broader topix down 0.9 % to 1,596.06 .
the shanghai composite fell 0.13 % and india 's sensex is 0.2 % lower .
south korean markets are closed for a public holiday .
author: Leisha Chi
Business reporter in Singapore

documents.title: discounters will take £ 1 in every £ 7 spent
text: new research out today into the uk 's grocery market predicts that within the next five years £ 1 in every £ 7 will be spent at a discounter - like aldi and lidl .
the grocery research organisation , the igd , is also forecasting stronger growth for the industry as a whole , driven by increasing food prices .
at the same time the igd reckons that in the next few years nearly a quarter of british shoppers may be buying through online supermarkets

documents.title: joules sales jump by nearly 20 %
text: smart-casual clothing brand joules saw its group sales jump by 18.6 % in the year to 28 may .

the retailer 's trading update - which covered the first full year since it joined aim on 26 may 2016 - said : `` this strong growth is a reflection of the brand 's expansion in the uk and international markets , joules ' growing customer base , and the positive customer responses to both new and core ranges across product categories throughout the period . ''
retail revenue rose by about 19.4 % `` driven by strong growth in the e-commerce channel '' as well as continued growth in the uk and republic of ireland where joules opened 11 new stores .
meanwhile , wholesale revenues rose 17.6 % helped by `` strong growth '' in the spring/summer order-book from both uk and international wholesale customers , said joules .

documents.title: what next for ba ?
text: thomas moore , ‎an investment director at standard life investments , says iag 's share price has n't moved much since ba 's it debacle last week .
but the firm does need to compensate passengers which `` could run into the hundreds of millions of pounds '' .
he also expects there to be an impact on future sales , because people will think twice about using ba and they have been `` scoring pretty badly in customer surveys . ''
`` there is a risk that unless they stem the damage by taking action this could have an impact on profits and sales , '' he tells the today programme .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: heidi klum links with lidl
text: international supermodel heidi klum is releasing a new `` high-end '' fashion range - with the budget supermarket lidl .
klum , who is one of the highest-paid models in the world , has made a range which is `` accessible for everyone , '' according to the german supermarket .
lidl says that klum 's new range `` mirrors her characteristic style '' .
read more here

documents.title: is buy-to-let still a risk ?
text: after the financial crisis buy to let properties were identified as a risk to the economy , and regulators brought in measures to cool the market .
have they worked ?
paul smee , director general of the council of mortgage lenders , says if there was `` froth in the market '' it 's been taken out by now .
by to let lending is down 17 % in two years .
mr smee says the so called `` dinner party landlord '' has withdrawn from the market leaving a smaller , more professional group .
however , he says competitive mortgages are still available and he cautions against further regulations for the sector , saying recent policies are still working their way through the system .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: airline industry profits to rise
text: the global airline industry is forecast to have another bumper financial year , but with some potentially bumpy rides ahead .
the international air transport association ( iata ) raised its profit forecast to $ 31.4bn this year , up from the previous forecast of $ 29.8bn .
iata , which has 275 member airlines , attributed this to strong growth in passenger and cargo demand .
about half the profits came from north america .

speaking at the group 's annual meeting in the mexican resort city of cancun , iata director general alexandre de juniac said `` airlines are defining a new epoch in industry profitability '' but he warned that government protectionism remains a major headwind .
this includes the `` surprise '' decision by the us and uk to ban laptop and tablet computers in cabins on certain flights which could cost the industry an estimated $ 3.3bn each year .
author: Leisha Chi
Business reporter in Singapore

documents.title: qatar row will have 'negligible impact ' on exports
text: qatar is the world 's biggest exporter of liquefied natural gas .
on wake up to money john sfakianakis from the gulf research center in riyadh said he thought the current restrictions would have a `` negligible impact '' on that industry .
`` they will still be able to export everything .

so it 's just a matter of qatar finding its niche , but it 's disturbing and difficult for their daily lives if suddenly they 're told that there is no milk on the shelves coming from the uae or saudi arabia , but qatar 's exports as well as their investments , especially in the uk , i do n't think they 'll be disturbed whatsoever . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: 'better education needed to tackle skills shortages '
text: kevin green of the recruitment and employment confederation has told the bbc the uk needs to invest more in young people to tackle our widening skills shortages .
`` we need to invest more in education and careers advice , what people do at university and tuition fees , perhaps making tuition free for certain subjects in the future . ''
economist vicky pryce says businesses could do more too .
instead of investing in improving productivity , firms are still taking the cheaper , easier option of hiring skilled labour from abroad .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: south korea on bird flu alert
text: south korea has raised its bird flu alert level to maximum today after the highly pathogenic h5n8 strain was recently found on a farm on the island of jeju .
the government said it plans to take `` all-out preventive measures '' to contain the spread of bird flu , which is highly contagious and can be deadly to humans .
this includes implementing a 24-hr ban on transporting poultry nationwide .
south korea has raised the country 's bird flu alert level to maximum only twice in its history , the first having been late last year .

the country has culled more than a fifth of its total poultry population since november , which has devastated the local industry and forced authorities to dispense disaster compensation to affected farmers and import eggs from overseas .

documents.title: uk skills shortages intensifying since brexit vote
text: the uk is facing a severe shortage of skilled workers , the recruitment & employment confederation has said .
chief executive kevin green tells radio 4 the issue applies to a wide range of sectors , from the nhs to construction , engineering to digital .
the problem is spread across the uk , not just in london .
economist vicky pryce blames a drop-off in eu citizens coming to work in the uk since the brexit vote .

`` in the past we have tended not invest enough in our own people to fill those gaps , but of course it is much cheaper to get people from abroad who have already been educated by their own public sectors .
but that ca n't go on for ever . ''
is pay keeping up ?
mr green says that starting salaries are rising , but we may see wages rise across the board in the future as shortages intensify .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: qatar 's imports face disturbance
text: more from john sfakianakis , of the gulf research center who was on wake up to money .
he was asked about the impact of the row on qatar .
`` qatar is an import-dependent economy .
it borders saudi arabia and it imports a lot of its daily goods , food items , from saudi arabia so that will be a distrurbance .
`` if it [ the restrictions ] stays over the medium term it will impact qatar 's economy definitely , but it think it will be resolved , '' he added .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: updated passenger advice from qatar airways
text: as we reported yesterday , a handful of arab nations have cut diplomatic and transport ties with qatar over claims it is funding terrorism .
qatar airways , the gulf state 's national carrier , has put out some updated advice for passengers who may be affected .
qatar airways puts out passenger advice .
no uae , bahrain , saudi , egypt flights & not using their airspace .
going to have a huge impact on qatar airways - many dubai based expats use qa coz of significantly better prices vs emirates etc .

documents.title: saudi arabia faces disruption
text: we heard yesterday that several gulf states have severed ties with qatar over accusations of supporting extremism in the region .
transport links to the country have been cut from saudi arabia , the uae , egypt and bahrain .
qatar denies backing militants .
the country 's main stock index fell 7 % ,
john sfakianakis , director of economics research at the gulf research center in riyadh , saudi arabia was on wake up to money .
he said the restrictions on airspace would have an impact .
`` it does disrupt people even in saudi arabia because they do use qatar airways to fly around the world .
qatar airways will have to find new routes to fly its planes , espectially towards the west , so they can no longer fly over saudi arabia .
it 's going to take longer which means it 's going to be more expensive , so it will add to the complexity . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning
text: the boss of iag , british airways ' parent company , has blamed human error for the computer problems which caused chaos ten days ago .
willie walsh , said an engineer had disconnected the power supply to a data centre and then reconnected it without following the correct procedure .

there 's just two days of campaigning left before people vote in the general election - and the conservatives have said they will create a new board of trade - and a global network of trade commissioners - to help strike deals around the world after brexit .
the liberal democrats said the ideas were outdated .
coming up later we 'll have the latest brc retail sales figures for may and full year results from ao - appliances online .
we 'll bring you the reaction to those stories and all the other business news as it emerges , so do stay with us if you can .
